meanings.def: to take control of a country or city and its people by force
examples: In 330 BC Persia was conquered by Alexander the Great.
The Roman empire offered citizenship to its conquered peoples.

meanings.def: to defeat somebody, especially in a competition, race, etc.
examples: The world champion conquered yet another challenger last night.

meanings.def: to succeed in dealing with or controlling something
examples: The only way to conquer a fear is to face it.
Mount Everest was conquered (= successfully climbed) in 1953.
He will need to conquer his nerves to progress in this competition.

meanings.def: to become very popular or successful in a place
examples: The band is now setting out to conquer the world.
This is a British film which could conquer the US market.
